column1: This is a substance that causes an allergic reaction.
This series of allergy shots may help reduce your allergy symptoms.
First, work with your doctor to identify which allergens are causing your symptoms.
This can cause bothersome symptoms in the nose, eyes, and lungs.
Treatment with allergy shots is also called immunotherapy.
When a small amount of an allergen is injected into the body, the immune system makes a substance called an antibody that blocks the allergen from causing symptoms.
For some persons, allergy shots can prevent new allergies and reduce asthma symptoms.

You may benefit from allergy shots if you have: - Asthma that is worsened by allergies - Allergic rhinitis, allergic conjunctivitis - Insect bite sensitivity - Eczema, a skin condition that can be caused by dust mite allergy Allergy shots are effective for common allergens such as: - Weed and tree pollen - Grass - Mold or fungi - Animal dander - Dust mites - Insect stings Adults (including the elderly) as well as children can receive allergy shots.
Food allergies are not treated with allergy shots.
Some people have mild nasal stuffiness or runny nose.
